name: Technical Support & Cloud Services Manager
description:
*instinctools is looking for an experienced Technical Support & Cloud Services Manager who is eager to undertake various solid tasks and see problems before they happen.

About the project:
Global management consulting firm that advises the world's leading businesses, governments and institutions. With more than 95 offices in over 50 countries.

Our client’s platform is a customizable set of 15 components that can be assembled to serve different clients journeys across industries and functions. Each module serves a business purpose such as data visualization, data management, storyboarding, workflow, etc. Main goal of the platform – reduce time to market of insights through the usage of already-existing components.

It’s worth joining us if you want to be responsible for:

  • Manage 1st and 2nd line technical support personnel.
  • Define, implement and manage technical support processes and procedures.
  • Produce weekly and monthly KPI reporting.
  • Manage and report on our support processes, including root cause analysis and remedial action.
  • Create and drive initiatives to improve quality, performance and SOP's for Support & DevOpsEngineers
  • Manage prioritisation, escalation and resolution of support incidents to the development teams.
  • Ensure the ticketing and documentation process for all support incidents is adhered to.
  • Manage support documentation and knowledge base articles.
  • Identifying areas for self-serve and automation and leading said innovations. Technical Support & Cloud Services Manager
  • Active member of the engineering leadership team and a proactive agent for improvementchanges across the organization.

Our expectations of the ideal candidate:

  • 6+ years experience managing support of modern cloud-based SaaS systems in a fast paced environment
  • Experience managing both Help Desk and Site Reliability Engineer teams
  • Understanding of complex enterprise systems and solutions with experience planning monitoring, alerting and incident management is required
  • Working knowledge of modern day DevOps and software development practices
  • Familiarity with cloud technologies, AWS and/or Azure in particular
  • Familiarity of compliance and certifications, e.g. SOC2
  • Ideally post graduate in a Computer Science discipline

We offer:

  • A relaxed atmosphere without formalism and bureaucracy;
  • Flexible working time;
  • Diverse benefits package and soulful office parties;
  • Stability. We have been on the market for 21 years and we are HTP Belarus resident;

About our company:

Currently our company is going through the stage of active growth and changes which means we are building a brand new corporate culture - the culture of growth and self-development.

Our main focus now is on personal and working environment upgrading. We strongly believe that professionalism of employees is one of the company’s main assets so we arrange internal training and coaching sessions as well as knowledge sharing meetups on a regular basis. Additionally, in summertime we run a number of open-air external meetups where our colleagues share their experience with professionals outside the company.

You have an amazing opportunity to join our team and take part in realization of inspiring company’s goals.
